channel.title: Alternate path? (Either in "Blast Pit" or "Power Up")
channel.description:
Unfortunately I can't remember which of the two levels I was playing, but I happened upon an elevator and then realized there was a grate that let me take ANOTHER path that involved lots of ladders (with a fall at the bottom), and a music track that I don't believe would have played had I taken the elevator.
Was this path in Half-Life or added by the Black Mesa team? I was just curious because it was a moment that stood out to me and I know that you guys can answer this question for me XD.

item.title: Alternate path? (Either in "Blast Pit" or "Power Up")
item.dc:creator: Th3On3Fr33man
item.description:
dky.tehkingd.u:

In the original, you have no choice but to take a (really unnecessarily fancy) elevator. The ladder path didn’t exist.

There we go, and thats what I thought.

Really cool addition, as well as the music guys. Reminded me of the great moment in Half-Life 2 where you go under the bridge (which isn’t alternate of course).

Read full topic
item.source: Alternate path? (Either in "Blast Pit" or "Power Up")

item.title: Alternate path? (Either in "Blast Pit" or "Power Up")
item.dc:creator: Th3On3Fr33man
item.description:
Ok, I stopped being lazy and found it:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=gesxA9oIX8k

Its in the beginning of Blast Pit around 00:53. He doesn’t use the alternate pathway though.

My question was if that was originally in Half-Life or if the developers added this moment. I just don’t remember from my playthrough.

Read full topic
item.source: Alternate path? (Either in "Blast Pit" or "Power Up")

item.title: Alternate path? (Either in "Blast Pit" or "Power Up")
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
I wouldn’t count that as an “alternate path” since both the elevator and ladders go the same way and are a few meters from each other… the only difference is an extra battery or health kit lol

Read full topic
